title: 11  Technical Report
text:
12 Title page
Documentation of your psychometrics project occurs within a technical report. The technical report contains, at minimum:
Your goal within a technical report is the exact communication of development and investigation of psychometric properties of your focal measure. You should use the reading level necessary to convey your project with the highest level of semantic integrity.1
Although you can use style guidelines (such as may be found in the publication manual of the APA), you should not feel constrained by these. The content should reflect the elements within List 11.1, but the format should reflect the authoring organization. Have some fun with the format – use icons, images, and even (non–obtrusive) fonts with restrained abandon. You may want to consult a friend who has experience with graphic design or other artistic ventures. The format should reflect YOU, not some stodgy arbiter of margin dimensions or running head capitalization.

title: 11  Technical Report
text: The anticipated reading–level of technical report information should be considered and aimed at the intended audience (commonly, but not always, college–level). Information should also often be made available to a general consumer audience (7th–grade reading level) in the form of white papers, local validation studies, and marketing material.↩︎
